Package com.rb.nonbiz.reflection

Class RBClass<T>

java.lang.Object
com.rb.nonbiz.reflection.RBClass<T>
public class RBClass<T>
extends java.lang.Object
A generalization of Class that also gives the class information for the classes 'inside the angle brackets' in the case of generics.

Java supports Class objects as part of its reflection API. However, because generics were not part of the original Java specification and got added later, Java uses "type erasure" (you can look it up) and doesn't have any knowledge during runtime about the generic class arguments. That is, I can call Object.getClass() on a runtime object of type Foo<X, Y> and get Foo.class, but there's no way to get X.class or Y.class. This data class stores that extra information as well.

    • rbClass

    • shallowGenericRbClass

      public static <T> RBClass<T> shallowGenericRbClass​(java.lang.Class<T> outerClass, java.lang.Class<?> first, java.lang.Class<?>... rest)
      Constructs a RBClass for a generic class, where the arguments inside the angle brackets are non-generic classes.

      'Shallow generic' is not a real term, but hopefully it's intuitive.

    • uniqueIdRbClass

      public static <T> RBClass<UniqueId<T>> uniqueIdRbClass​(RBClass<T> classOfUniqueId)
      Represents e.g. a UniqueId<Partition<AssetClass>> or some other situation where the class inside the UniqueId is also generic (in addition to UniqueId, which is generic).

    • uniqueIdRbClass

      public static <T> RBClass<UniqueId<T>> uniqueIdRbClass​(java.lang.Class<T> classOfUniqueId)
      Represents e.g. a UniqueId<NamedFactor> or some other situation where the class inside the UniqueId is not itself generic (even though obviously UniqueId is).
